resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #8093:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8093#discussion_r481935199



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/util/cpu_info.h
##########
@@ -59,6 +59,12 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT CpuInfo {
     L3_CACHE = 2,
   };
 
+  enum Vendor {

Review comment:
       Better use to a `enum class`:
   ```c++
   enum class Vendor { Unknown, Intel, AMD };
   ```

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #8093:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8093#discussion_r481935643



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/util/cpu_info.h
##########
@@ -101,6 +107,9 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT CpuInfo {
   /// Returns the model name of the cpu (e.g. Intel i7-2600)
   std::string model_name();
 
+  /// Returns whether or not the cpu is provided by this vendor.
+  bool IsVendor(Vendor vendor) const { return vendor == vendor_; }

Review comment:
       It would seem more useful to expose the vendor directly:
   ```c++
   Vendor vendor() const { ... }
   ```

   >

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: This is needed to do runtime dispatches for places where pext/pdep can be used.  These perform poorly on AMD.
fields.summary: [C++] Add functionality to cpu_info to discriminate between Intel vs AMD x86

comments.body: [~frank.du] do you have any interest in looking at this?
Sure, I will take a look
